##Blue Sky Squad, behind the crash

Weixin Signal Wowjiemian

Function introduction, the interface news is China has the influence original financial and economic new media, only serves the independent thinking crowd

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Image: Visual China

By Meng Zhao

“

"To take volunteerism seriously, and in particular the rights of volunteers, is to treat volunteers well, as well as all members of the public who benefit or are about to benefit from volunteering, and our society and our future. "

”

“

"To take volunteerism seriously, and in particular the rights of volunteers, is to treat volunteers well, as well as all members of the public who benefit or are about to benefit from volunteering, and our society and our future. "

”

"Be a good boy, dad went to Wuhan to fight monsters! " 11 days after a friend on Wechat wrote this, Xu Peng, a member of the Suzhou Blue Sky Rescue Team, was killed in a car accident on his way to deliver supplies to support Wuhan's "fight against the epidemic. ". In the fight against the new pneumonia, the blue sky team sent out six hundred rescue workers, all of them unpaid civilian volunteers.

Like them, there are tens of thousands of ordinary volunteers in communities across Wuhan. These active folk forces have played an irreplaceable role in the continued operation of Wuhan Community after the blockade.

Jin Jinping, Director of the nonprofit organization at Peking University, wrote that volunteerism can fill the gap left by market failures and government failures, and expand the power of social and public welfare. In the past disaster relief operations and Public Health Response, volunteer service has been difficult to replace because of its flexibility, close to the individual, timely detection and fill the blind spots and so on.

But little-known is that this group of huge "Public Welfare Ranger" , but long-term in the insurance insufficient embarrassing state. In the event of an accident in voluntary service, volunteers often can only use public donations and the application of honorary title of the way, to seek medical treatment or to the family's pension.

As early as 2013, the Ministry of Civil Affairs proposed promoting the establishment of a voluntary insurance system in accordance with the guidelines for the construction of a contingent of volunteers in China's social service (2013-2020) , the responsibility subject, risk-involved scope and risk-bearing mechanism of volunteer insurance should be clearly defined. But implementation has not been ideal.

On March 5, the Ministry of Civil Affairs and the Tencent Holdings jointly launched the "care and security action for volunteers, community workers, social workers and workers of elderly institutions in Hubei Province" , special Insurance will be provided free of charge to all kinds of volunteers participating in epidemic prevention and control throughout the country. Serious and critically ill patients will receive 50,000 yuan of protection, and those who die will receive 250,000 yuan of protection.

This makes the participation of the "anti-epidemic" service of Civil Volunteers feel comfort. Pro Bono advocates argue that such temporary policies need to be institutionalized in order to better protect the rights of volunteers and sustain volunteerism in future volunteer service.

Before Xu Peng participates in the rescue mission, according to the regulations of the Blue Sky Rescue Team, the official team members must purchase an annual rescue insurance of 560 yuan, with a maximum compensation of 800,000 yuan for death. In addition, the goods Xu helped transport were covered by the China Charity Federation, which also took out an insurance policy for him. At present, the Blue Sky Rescue Team is assisting Xu Peng to declare martyrs.

The Public Welfare Ranger is indispensable

Before the Spring Festival in 2020, Xu and his friend Li Chen agreed to meet at their Joint Tattoo Studio after the holiday. On Feb. 5, Li Chen called Xu and told him to meet him at the store the next day, but he told him that he had arrived in Wuhan to help.

Li Chen had been saving his vintage for years to drink when Xu returned to Suzhou, but half a month later, he was waiting for news of his death. Xu Peng, 39, was killed in a car accident in Liangping County in the early hours of February 21, when he was transporting epidemic prevention supplies from Shandong to Wuhan.

Li Chen told interface news that before joining the Blue Sky Rescue Team, Xu was always ready to help others, but had not found the "organization. ". A character like him, once he finds "organization" , he will be "out of control" .

Li Chen was Xu's college friend, and together they formed a band, with Xu as the lead singer and Li Chen as the drummer. Li Chen remembers him as a man of many talents. Xu's hometown, Dafeng District, is the hometown of Shi Nai'an, the author of all men are brothers, who "looks like a man from Liangshan County" to his friends.

On a trip to Tibet with friends like Xu and Li Chen, a man and a stewardess clashed on the train, and the argument soon turned into a fight. The other passengers were silent when Xu stood up and threw the man to the ground. Xu Peng's action has also been rewarded, that their luggage accidentally left in the car, the flight attendant quickly help them find return.

Another time, in Shanghai Disneyland Park, a man beside if no one cut in line, Xu Peng came forward to dissuade, the other side at first do not listen, Xu Peng will give him reason. "At last everyone applauded, " Li Chen said, and the man was left to clay.

One year, Xu Peng and a few friends self-driving travel to a certain place in the West, just met the Blue Sky Rescue Team in this rescue operation, a batch of materials can not be delivered, Xu Peng will help with his off-road vehicle to. This became an opportunity to change the course of Xu Peng's life.

Around 2016, Xu joined the Jiangsu Blue Sky Rescue Team, and soon changed from a volunteer to a reserve member, a regular member of the team. He was less than 40 years old and was promoted to captain of the Blue Sky Rescue team. Li Chen has heard Xu Peng joke, "rescue is a bottomless pit" , "a billionaire becomes a multimillionaire, a millionaire becomes a millionaire" , but he is still not tired.

As a social organization, the National Blue Sky Rescue Team members more than 50,000, these members are divided into regular members, reserve members and volunteers three levels. No matter whether they are regular members, reserve members or volunteers, they do not have a contractual relationship with the blue sky rescue team. They are all volunteers in a legal sense and are governed by the volunteer service regulations.

Xu Peng and Li Chen and other friends have opened a tattoo studio, joined the Blue Sky Rescue Team, Xu Peng will rarely take into account the studio. His image has appeared in the Funing storm, the Guangyuan Shipwreck, Yushu snow disaster and other accident sites. He was even sent to Tibet, Hoh Xil, Burma, Laos and other missions.

Blue Sky Rescue Team has a member of Nanjing, was an orphan, the team let him find his value, almost all his income to the rescue team.

Xu Peng's colleague in the Blue Sky Rescue Team, Cai Chao, said that people in the Blue Sky rescue team like to laugh at themselves as "crazy people. " All the expenses of the rescue need to be borne by themselves, but there are still people who keep applying to join, "still really like to help people, feel happy inside bar. "

Jin Jinping, Director of the nonprofit organization at Peking University, has written that value-sensitive people who become involved in public welfare projects are surprised to find themselves quickly becoming "public welfare Rangers" , inspiring great potential, they can stay up all night and look good, and that's what keeps them going.

Jin Jinping said that voluntary service is a public participation behavior that bears public responsibility, and the voluntary assumption of social responsibility is the awakening of civic awareness. In the past disaster relief operations and the response to this public health event, volunteer service has attracted attention because of its flexibility, close to the individual, timely detection and fill the blind spots and other characteristics, highlighting its irreplaceable function.

The 2008 earthquake in Wenchuan County sounded the rallying call for volunteers, "There has never been a time in history when we were awakened to the fact that we live in a society where there are so many people with conscience, integrity and responsibility who are willing to contribute their knowledge, physical ability, labour, experience, technology, time and so on. "

Active involvement in risks and difficulties in insurance

In fact, rescue as an active risk behavior, the risk is higher, has not been covered by insurance companies. In a dangerous situation but no insurance protection, "Public Welfare Rangers" have long been "pain.

Huang Hao, the head of the Blue Sky rescue team in a western province, told the interface news that there are two reasons for the lack of insurance for the rescue team members: First, the Insurance Company's insurance coverage against the rescue team is insufficient; Second, the rescue team is unable to provide insurance to the rescue team members, poor execution of the purchase of insurance. Especially in the early days of the Blue Sky Rescue Team, "almost all in the 'streaking' . "

Huang, a former media man whose experience covering the May 12 earthquake in 2008 changed the course of his life, found that instead of using his pen to write articles that indirectly promoted problem solving, he could organize and participate directly. So, he joined just established the Blue Sky rescue team, become the first batch of blue sky rescue team members.

In 2008, civilian rescue was a new thing, and there was no insurance against the rescue of ordinary volunteers. Some Blue Sky Rescue Team members to participate in the rescue, can only buy their own ordinary personal accident insurance, but the relevant insurance regulations, active involvement in insurance is not covered, "bought it is difficult to obtain compensation. ".

With the frequent occurrence of natural disasters in recent years, let the Blue Sky Rescue Team Reputation, the rescue team "streaking" state attracted attention. In 2013, the Ministry of Civil Affairs issued the guiding outline for the construction of a contingent of volunteers in social services in China (2013-2020) , which proposed to promote the establishment of a volunteer insurance system and clarify the subjects of responsibility, the scope of risks involved and the mechanism for assuming risks in volunteer insurance.

Around 2015, an insurance company added a small amount of insurance for rescue team members, temporary purchase, premium 3 yuan a day, according to the daily calculation, the maximum compensation for death of 100,000 yuan. Several blue sky rescue team members said that this kind of insurance payment is "better than nothing, " they did not expect the insurance to bring their own peace of mind, can only be in the rescue process "for their own good. ".

Huang Hao was unable to buy insurance for the rescue workers, found the relevant departments to reflect, the relevant leaders had convened the Provincial Insurance Association and rescue workers held a coordination meeting. The Insurance Company said at the meeting that it would try to add a new type of insurance that would be suitable for rescue workers, "but it was dropped. "

In recent years, some insurance companies have added insurance for civilian rescue teams, but the premium is in the thousands of yuan. At the beginning of 2019, an insurance company added a large amount of annual insurance for Blue Sky rescue teams, paying a premium of 560 yuan per year, with a maximum payment of 800,000 yuan in the event of death.

According to the uniform requirements of the Blue Sky Rescue Team, all the regular members, reserve members and volunteers of the Blue Sky rescue team should buy insurance when they participate in the rescue, Jang Yong, the national commander of the Blue Sky Rescue Team, told interface news. But the Blue Sky rescue team belongs to the "brand authorization" model. The Blue Sky rescue teams all over the country operate independently. The headquarters and the local rescue teams are not in a leadership relationship, it's still up to the rescue teams.

According to the interface news, in the Suzhou Blue Sky Rescue Team where Xu Peng is, every official member of the team is required to purchase annual rescue insurance on his own. Reserve members and volunteers do not have the requirement to purchase annual insurance, they often buy only a temporary new rescue policy of 3 yuan a day.

According to the regulations of the Blue Sky Rescue Team, only the official members wearing blue clothes can participate in the rescue. The reserve members can only do some "auxiliary work" , "equivalent to training" . Sometimes they have to go to the rescue site. In case of an accident, temporary rescue teams and volunteers receive lower compensation.

Not all rescue teams, like the Jiangsu Blue Sky Rescue Team, require their regular members to purchase annual rescue insurance. In August 2019, Shenzhen Blue Sky Rescue Team members Xu Tingxiu and Yin Qihe in the rescue of stranded donkey friends, suddenly encountered a sudden rise in the river and the bulk of the troops separated from the unfortunate death. A member of the Blue Sky Rescue team involved in the aftermath said that neither of them had taken out annual rescue insurance, only taking out 3 yuan of insurance per day, and the family could only get 100,000 yuan of insurance compensation.

"fortunately, their parents are very understanding, and if we insist on asking why the rescue team did not buy insurance for their children, we will be in trouble, " the person said.

Love and worry of community volunteers

In addition to professional volunteer teams such as the Blue Sky Rescue Team, there are tens of thousands of ordinary volunteers active in various communities in Wuhan, who played a key role in the normal operation of Wuhan residents'lives during the city closure, but their insurance issues have received little attention.

On February 23, Wuhan launched the "Volunteer Service Care Action" , a city-wide initiative to recruit volunteers to provide food and medicine for residents in their communities. Three days after the announcement, the number of applicants topped 50,000, local media reported.

Wuhan's "Volunteer Care Action" volunteer recruitment notice requires the Wuhan Urban District Prevention and Control Headquarters and the district civilized office to provide the necessary protection and job security for volunteers to carry out their work, traffic control departments and districts provide passes for volunteers to carry out voluntary service activities.

On February 26, Li Bo, a community resident in Changzhou, Wuhan, signed up as a volunteer through the community. His job is to help residents can not go out in the community "running errands" , occasionally patrolling the area, to persuade people do not stay out too long activities.

The Changzhou community is large, recruiting hundreds of volunteers, some of whom are freelancers like Li Bo, who have never volunteered before and have little understanding of their duties and rights, "just do as you're told. "

A worker in the Changzhou Community said there was no plan to buy insurance for volunteers. "volunteers are people who help people without asking for anything in return. If you want something, don't join. "

In fact, after the outbreak, a number of insurance companies have also specifically increased the risk of new crown pneumonia, or in the original accident insurance, new crown pneumonia infection coverage. But the volunteer organizers and volunteers themselves, lack the sense of active insurance.

Li Bo worked three shifts a day, took care of his own food and lodging, had no pay and no insurance. But his safety awareness is higher, the day before going out service, hidden from his family spent 68 yuan, bought a cover of new crown pneumonia accident insurance, up to 200,000 yuan. Other volunteers, many without insurance.

In addition to Wuhan, other cities in Hubei have also recruited large numbers of volunteers to serve their communities. Wang is a volunteer in a community in Suizhou, Hubei Province, where he has been serving for more than half a month and is short-staffed and on call. Wang himself has no insurance. "We're volunteers, and we're too embarrassed to ask for it, " he said

Supplies were tight for the first few days, and Li Bo was only given a mask and gloves a day, before he was given some disinfectant. He prepares two sets of clothes a day, wears one during service, takes it off before going home, puts on another, and then washes his hands repeatedly with disinfectant.

The "manual of volunteering" requires them to avoid contact with people who might be carrying the virus, but the risks are still not absolute. Once, the community an old man accidentally cut his hand, need to be sent to the hospital. "people are afraid to go to the hospital, which is a high-risk area, " said Li Bo, who was among several volunteers who took the injured to the hospital after a mental struggle.

"I was really scared, and you didn't know if there was a patient with a fever, " said Li Bo, who arrived at the hospital's entrance, hesitated to go in and eventually accompanied the patient through all the formalities. When paying the bill, the old man found that he forgot to bring the money, ready to contact his wife to send the money. Li Bo covered his own exposure for his family.

A few days later, another volunteer who was on patrol in the community suddenly fell into a coma and was rushed to the hospital. Fortunately, he was not hurt, just food poisoning. The doctor reminded Li Bo to return home not only to wash his hands with disinfectant, but also to "rotate" his nostrils and ears with alcohol-soaked cotton balls. It was then that Li Bo realized he had underestimated the risks of volunteering.

Wuhan's caring action for Voluntary Service recruitment notice requires that volunteers who have accumulated a certain amount of service hours receive a certificate of voluntary service of the appropriate level, outstanding performance in the city of all kinds of excellent volunteers in the selection of priority.

"It doesn't mean much to a freelancer like me, " said Li Bo, whose only wish was that the epidemic would end and he would be safe. "The idea was simple: Do what you can to help. ".

Being kind to volunteers is being kind to society and the future

Jin Jinping believes that although volunteers participate in public welfare services, but also enjoy a number of rights, including the right to access information related to volunteer activities, the right to receive training; The right to obtain the material and safety guarantees necessary for participation in voluntary service activities; and the right to obtain insurance for them from voluntary service organizations.

Jin said the rights of volunteers are embodied in relevant legislation, and need to be made clear in volunteer recruitment instructions and volunteer service agreements.

A large number of volunteers are active in community service, which has attracted the attention of the civil affairs department. On March 5, China Volunteer Day, the Ministry of Civil Affairs and the Tencent Holdings jointly launched the "care and protection action for volunteers, community workers, social workers and workers of old-age institutions in Hubei Province" .

The policy provides special insurance coverage for volunteers, community workers, social workers and staff of old-age care institutions in Hubei Province who participate in epidemic prevention and control throughout the country. Eligible people can apply for the Insurance Online, critically ill patients will receive 50,000 yuan protection, the deceased will receive 250,000 yuan protection.

It was a relief to the volunteers involved in the outbreak. However, Huang believes that such temporary policies need to be institutionalized so that the legitimate rights of volunteers can be guaranteed in the future in the course of regular volunteer service.

According to the Regulations on volunteer service issued in 2017, "before volunteering organizations arrange volunteers to participate in voluntary activities that may cause personal danger, they should purchase the corresponding personal accident insurance for the volunteers. " This means that the subjects responsible for purchasing insurance for the volunteers, in a volunteer organization. But in the concrete implementation, the stipulation and the reality existence disparity.

Many public welfare organizations, like Blue Sky Rescue, do not have a fixed income, Huang said. Occasionally, some businesses donate or help other organizations train for income, but they can not afford insurance for everyone. "If you ask your players to buy it themselves, not everyone can do it, " he said.

Volunteer rescue teams on the Yangtze face similar problems. Cai, who is in charge of the team's insurance affairs, told interface news that since the prices of specialized rescue insurance are generally high, they can only buy ordinary accident insurance for the rescue team. In case of an accident, whether they can obtain satisfactory compensation is uncertain.

The Yangtze rescue team has no income, and the cost of insurance can only rely on corporate sponsorship. Cai said that some people are in a bad financial situation, but they are enthusiastic about public welfare and have rescue skills. They can not be refused to join the rescue team. It is difficult to ensure the stable operation of the rescue team only by relying on corporate sponsorship to buy insurance.

Xu Xiaohua, a professor at the Central University of Finance and Economics, said it was "natural" for the organizers to buy insurance for the volunteers, and that they could not afford the huge premiums, he suggested that relevant ministries and state-owned insurance companies could be approached for unconventional support.

Xu Xiaohua told interface news that after the outbreak, various ministries and commissions issued policies to deal with the epidemic. "which one doesn't break the routine? " He said that China's welfare and relief system is relatively complete, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Affairs and the Department of Emergency Management have corresponding fund reserves, and the balance of the industrial injury insurance account is relatively large. Special circumstances to "dare to think" in order to give flexible play to these funds. He even suggested that volunteers could be included in the standard of work-related injuries.

According to Wei Heng (Nanjing) , a lawyer with the law firm in Beijing, whether or not voluntary service is developed can reflect the level of social civilization and governance. If government and ngos (non-governmental organization) are regarded as standing armies of social services, then the vast majority of volunteers can be called reserve army. The government and ngos have limited manpower, and in the event of a major event such as an epidemic or an earthquake, the role of volunteers can not be replaced.

"volunteer services are unpaid, but that does not mean that our society and government can ignore the risks they take, " the top said, citing the epidemic as an example if the government recruits volunteers in accordance with the law or ad hoc policies, it is the responsibility of the government to supplement the lack of administrative power and to provide insurance and other necessary guarantees for volunteers. According to the "voluntary service regulations" , providing corresponding protection for volunteers constitutes the government's administrative obligation to pay.

Huang mentioned that the Volunteer Service Ordinance stipulates that, "voluntary service at or above the county level shall be incorporated into the National Economic and social development plan, the funds required for voluntary service shall be rationally arranged, and the development of voluntary service in a wide range of coverage, at various levels and in a wide range of Government of the People's Republic of China. " In some parts of Jiangxi, the government provides premium support to 50 people a year for local blue sky rescue teams, but in many underdeveloped areas volunteers are left to fend for themselves.

(at the request of the interviewees, Huang Hao, Li Bo and Wang Zheng were given pseudonyms.)
